text: the 2008 Summer Olympic Games an English
lesson for the advanced student this is
part 2 and our focus will be on
listening skills
task 1 recalling details watch each clip
and answer the questions I'm so happy to
have a DVR I don't have a lot of time to
watch TV
so the DVR allows me to record programs
I don't want to miss like the Olympics
question one why does Jennifer like the
DVR the answer she doesn't have a lot of
time to watch TV
so the DVR allows her to record programs
that she would otherwise miss this month
millions of people around the world
turned their attention to Beijing China
and watched the 2008 Summer Olympic
Games there were many memorable moments
for the athletes but to be honest the
event that made the strongest impression
on me was the opening ceremony question
2 which event of the 2008 Summer Olympic
Games made the strongest impression on
Jennifer answer the opening ceremony
impressed her the most
I think the creators of the show knew
even before August 8th that they have
created a spectacular event that the
world would talk about for generations
to come
the fact is that China with its
exhaustive use of resources and high
level of organization has raised the bar
for all other host cities in the future
question 3 according to Jennifer what
made the opening ceremony a spectacular
event answer she said that China
exhausted its resources and maintained a
high level of organization on August 8th
thousands of lucky people crowded into
the Beijing National Stadium the bird's
nest and watched the largest and most
expensive opening ceremony ever
questions 4 & 5 when was the opening
ceremony held answer August 8 2008
what is the bird's nest answer the
Beijing National Stadium everyone knows
that China has the largest population in
the world and the opening ceremony
reflected this it was simply
breathtaking to see over 15,000 people
perform together with such artistry and
skill no one in the stadium are watching
at home had ever seen a combination of
technology and artistry on this scale
2008 drummers with drums that lit up
a large LED paper scroll that appeared
to unroll over the stadium floor
dozens of dancers in exquisite costumes
these were just a handful of the many
creative ideas of one Chinese filmmaker
question six and seven jennifer was
impressed by the combination of artistry
and what else answer she found the
combination of artistry and technology
very impressive
who was the main creator of the opening
ceremony it was a Chinese filmmaker one
thing is for sure London has a tough act
to follow in the 2012 Olympic Games
everyone will compare the opening
ceremony to the one they saw in Beijing
China question 8 where will the 2012
Olympic Games be held answer London
England will host the 2012 Olympic Games

China question 3 what does jennifer
predict for future host cities of the
Olympic Games
answer she believes that the opening
ceremony in Beijing is a tough act to
follow
in other words it will be difficult for
a future host city to match that
performance in terms of size and quality
